dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 5630 IH: Inspector General Vacancy Act of 2014
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Murphy of Florida (for himself, Mr. Rice of South Carolina, Ms. Kuster, Mr. Swalwell of California, Mr. Jolly, Mr. Mulvaney, Ms. Sinema, and Mr. Peters of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To amend the Inspector General Act of 1976 to fill Inspector General vacancies, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Inspector General Vacancy Act of 2014.
Section 3 of the Inspector General Act of 1978 (5 U.S.C. App.) is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Nomination of Inspector General To fill a vacancy
subsection.text: If the President does not nominate an Inspector General pursuant to subsection (a) within 180 days after a vacancy for the Inspector General, the individual serving as interim Inspector General shall be deemed to be appointed under such subsection, by and with the advice and consent of the Senate.
